result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Jolly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael J. Jolly is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael J. Jolly was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Counseling as may be reocmmended.  Remanded to the custody of the Sheriff's department to serve jail time.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J. Jolly in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Michael J. Jolly in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  2:10 PM Court calls case and recites appearances.  State recites plea agreement - plead to count 1 3 yrs probation - 30 days jail with costs and other counts to be dismissed.  Atty McL agrees and makes stmt.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Defendant entered plea of NC to count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty count 1 and balance of charges are dismissed.  State makes stmt.  Atty McL makes arguement.  Defendant addressed the Court.  

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 3 years - costs - 30 days county jail - counseling as may be recommended - AODA and any follow thru - remanded to custody of WCSO to serve jail with huber and good time.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael J. Jolly in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Michael J. Jolly in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  Arraignment---Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.  Court notes the def. has filed a request for substitution.

Defendant Chrystal T. Webb in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant Chrystal T. Webb in custody.  Defendant Micheal Jolly in court with attorney James McLaughin. Mr. Jolly in custody. Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  both cases and appearances.  State calls Tyler Walsh to the stand.  Clerk swears in Inv. Walsh.  State questions Inv. Walsh.  
Inv. Walsh identifies Mr. Jolly and Ms. Webb.  Court finds he has identifed the def.  State continues questioning.   No further questions from the State.  Cross from Atty McL.  No further questions from Atty McL.   Cross from Atty Moldenhauer.  No further questions.  Re-direct from the state.  No further quesitons from the state. Re-cross from Atty McL.  Re-cross from Atty Moldenhauer.  Witness is excused.  No futher questions or witnesses.  Argument from Atty McL.   State speaks to the court.  Court finds there is probable cause that the def's committed a felony in Washburn County.  The def's are bound over for trial.  State offers information and both attorney's have received it.  Atty's request not to move on to arraignment today.

Defendant Michael J. Jolly in court in custody. Prosecuting Atty Thomas H Frost appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney James C. McLaughlin in court for Defendant Michael J. Jolly. Prosecuting Atty Thomas H Frost appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney James C. McLaughlin in court for Court calls case, cites appearances. Parties acknowledge receipt of criminal complaint.  Waive reading.  Def enters not guilty plea. Set for status.  Requests preliminary exam.  Mclaughlin requests bail modification.  Court denies modification, has warrants, $10,000 cash.  Status conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 04:15 pm.

No contact with C.T.W. or R.T. except for in the jail.  Not to consume any alcohol.  Not to enter an establishment that sells alcohol for nsumption on the premises.  Not to consume/possess any controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed Doctor.
